abstract: Minnesota Atty Gen Lori Swanson accuses Car Donation Foundation, one of state's largest vehicle donation charities, of devoting only one-fifth of its $108 million in gross revenue over four-year period to charitable causes; holds company spends rest on overhead, marketing and payments to two companies; investigation could result in litigation.
lead_paragraph: State Attorney General Lori Swanson said about one-fifth of the Car Donation Foundation’s $108 million in gross revenue over a four-year period went toward charitable grants.

headline.main: Minnesota: Car-Donor Foundation Is Accused of Giving Little to Charity
headline.print_headline: Minnesota: Car-Donor Foundation Is Accused of Giving Little to Charity

snippet: State Attorney General Lori Swanson said about one-fifth of the Car Donation Foundation’s $108 million in gross revenue over a four-year period went toward charitable grants.
